metadata.title: NBA CBA Study Materials - Batch 6: Article II - Player Contracts

questions.question: What is the minimum length of an NBA Player Contract?
options: 10 days
1 season
2 seasons
No minimum
questions.explanation: The minimum length is 10 days for injury replacement players. Standard contracts must be for at least the remainder of the season.

questions.question: What is the maximum length of a standard NBA Player Contract?
options: 4 years
5 years
6 years
No maximum
questions.explanation: Maximum is 5 years with Bird Rights or Early Bird Exception, and 4 years for all other contracts.

questions.question: Can a player contract include a no-trade clause?
options: Yes, for any player
Yes, but only for players with 8+ years of service and 4+ years with current team
No, no-trade clauses are prohibited
Yes, but only for max contract players
questions.explanation: Only players with 8+ years NBA service AND 4+ years with current team can negotiate a no-trade clause.

questions.question: What is a Two-Way Contract?
options: A contract allowing a player to play for two NBA teams
A contract splitting time between the NBA and G League
A contract with two different salary amounts
A contract requiring two-way trade approval
questions.explanation: Two-Way Contracts allow players to split time between an NBA team and its G League affiliate with different salary rates.

questions.question: How many days can a Two-Way player spend with the NBA team during a season?
options: 45 days
50 days
No limit
90 days
questions.explanation: Two-Way players can spend up to 50 days with their NBA team during the regular season.

questions.question: Can a player contract be renegotiated to increase the salary?
options: Yes, at any time
Yes, but only after 6 months
Yes, but only during a specified renegotiation period with restrictions
No, contracts cannot be renegotiated upward
questions.explanation: Contracts can be renegotiated upward only from the day after the last regular season game through June 30, with at least 2 years remaining.

questions.question: What is an Exhibit 10 Contract?
options: A 10-day contract
A contract with a bonus if the player is waived and joins the G League team
A contract for 10th roster spot
A performance bonus contract
questions.explanation: Exhibit 10 is a one-year minimum contract with up to $75,000 bonus if waived and signs with G League affiliate for 60+ days.

questions.question: Can a player contract include a player option for the final year?
options: Yes, without restriction
Yes, but only if the contract is 3+ years
No, only team options are allowed
Yes, but it requires league approval
questions.explanation: Player options can be included in any contract as a negotiated term without restrictions.

questions.question: What is the deadline for a player to exercise a player option?
options: June 15
June 25
June 29
July 1
questions.explanation: Players must exercise options by June 29, one day before free agency begins on June 30.

questions.question: Can contracts include payment protection for non-basketball injuries?
options: Yes, full protection is mandatory
Yes, but teams can negotiate partial or no protection
No, non-basketball injuries void all guarantees
Only for max contracts
questions.explanation: Basketball injuries are fully protected, but non-basketball injury protection is negotiable.

questions.question: What is the minimum salary for a player with 0 years of NBA service?
options: Fixed at $500,000
Set annually based on a percentage of the salary cap
$1 million
Negotiated individually
questions.explanation: Minimum salaries are set annually based on the salary cap and increase with years of service.

questions.question: How does the minimum salary increase with years of service?
options: Same rate regardless of years
5% per year
Based on a tiered scale (0 years, 1 year, 2 years, etc.)
10% per year
questions.explanation: Minimum salary has different tiers for each year of service from 0 to 10+ years.

questions.question: Can a team sign a player to multiple consecutive 10-day contracts?
options: Yes, unlimited 10-day contracts
Yes, up to two 10-day contracts, then must sign for remainder of season or release
No, only one 10-day contract allowed
Yes, up to three 10-day contracts
questions.explanation: Teams can sign a player to maximum two 10-day contracts, then must sign for season or release.

questions.question: What portion of a player's salary can be paid as a signing bonus?
options: Up to 10%
Up to 25%
No limit on signing bonus
Signing bonuses are prohibited
questions.explanation: NBA contracts cannot include signing bonuses. All compensation must be paid as salary.

questions.question: Can a player contract be assigned (traded) without the player's consent?
options: Yes, unless the player has a no-trade clause
No, player must always approve trades
Yes, but only within the same division
Only during the first 3 months of the contract
questions.explanation: Teams can trade players without consent unless they have a no-trade clause.

questions.question: What is the maximum salary a player can earn as a percentage of the salary cap?
options: No maximum
questions.explanation: Maximum is 35% for 10+ years service, 30% for 7-9 years, 25% for under 7 years.

questions.question: For maximum salary purposes, what counts as a 'year of service'?
options: Only seasons where the player was on an active roster
Any season where the player was under contract for at least 1 game
Full seasons only (must play majority of games)
Seasons credited based on a formula of games played
questions.explanation: A year of service is credited for any season with at least 1 game on an NBA roster.

questions.question: Can a contract include different salary amounts for each year?
options: No, must be the same each year
Yes, with specified maximum annual raises
Yes, unlimited variation allowed
Only if approved by the Players Association
questions.explanation: Contracts can have raises up to 8% (without Bird rights) or 10% (with Bird rights). No decreases allowed.

questions.question: What happens if a player under contract plays in an unauthorized basketball league?
options: Nothing, players can play anywhere in the offseason
The contract can be terminated and salary voided
A fine but contract remains valid
Suspension but guaranteed money is protected
questions.explanation: Playing in unauthorized leagues can result in contract termination and forfeiture of guaranteed salary.

questions.question: Can a contract be amended to add years after it is signed?
options: Yes, at any time via extension
No, only renegotiation of existing years is allowed
Yes, but only in the final year
Only with league approval
questions.explanation: Contracts can be extended to add years beyond the original term at any time.

questions.question: What is 'likely bonus' versus 'unlikely bonus' in contract terms?
options: Likely bonuses count against the cap, unlikely do not unless achieved
Both count against the cap immediately
Neither counts against the cap
Only likely bonuses are allowed in contracts
questions.explanation: Likely bonuses (achieved prior season) count against cap immediately. Unlikely bonuses only count if earned.

questions.question: Can a veteran player sign a Two-Way Contract?
options: No, only players with 3 or fewer years of service
Yes, any player can sign a Two-Way
No, only undrafted players
Yes, but only with 10+ years of service
questions.explanation: Any player with any amount of NBA experience can now sign Two-Way Contracts.

questions.question: What is the maximum value of an Exhibit 10 bonus?
options: No maximum
questions.explanation: Exhibit 10 bonuses max out at $75,000.

questions.question: Can a player's contract include trade restrictions beyond a no-trade clause?
options: Yes, can list specific teams they won't go to
No, only full no-trade clauses are allowed
Yes, can require notification before trades
Only maximum contract players can have trade restrictions
questions.explanation: Only full no-trade clauses are permitted. No partial clauses or trade kickers allowed.

questions.question: How are player salaries typically paid during the season?
options: One lump sum at start of season
Monthly payments over 12 months
Semi-monthly during the season (24 payments)
Weekly during the season
questions.explanation: Salaries are paid semi-monthly, resulting in 24 paychecks from Nov 15 through Oct 31.

questions.question: Can a team waive a player and then re-sign them immediately?
options: Yes, no restrictions
No, must wait 30 days
No, must wait until the next season
Yes, but only if claimed by another team first
questions.explanation: Teams must wait 30 days (or end of season) before re-signing a waived player.

questions.question: What is a 'make good' provision in a contract?
options: A bonus for good behavior
A clause requiring the player to repay salary if they underperform
A provision converting a non-guaranteed contract to guaranteed if specific conditions are met
A charity donation requirement
questions.explanation: Make good provisions convert non-guaranteed portions to guaranteed based on meeting criteria.

questions.question: Can guaranteed money in a contract be reduced after signing?
options: Yes, through renegotiation
Yes, if player violates contract terms
No, guaranteed money cannot be reduced
Only with player's written consent
questions.explanation: Guaranteed money can be voided if player violates specific contract terms.

questions.question: What is the 'over 36 rule' (also called the 'over 38 rule')?
options: Players over 36 cannot sign max contracts
Special salary cap treatment for contracts covering ages 36 and beyond
Players over 36 must take minimum salary
Maximum 2-year contracts for players over 36
questions.explanation: Contracts covering age 38+ seasons receive special cap treatment with salary allocation to earlier years.

questions.question: Can a player negotiate a contract that pays more in earlier years than later years?
options: Yes, declining salaries are allowed
No, salaries must increase or stay level
Yes, but only for veteran minimum contracts
Only with league approval
questions.explanation: Salaries must increase or stay level. Declining salaries are not permitted.

questions.question: What happens to a player's contract if they are permanently disabled during the season?
options: Contract is immediately terminated
Team continues to pay full salary
Player receives insurance payment, team can apply for salary cap relief
Contract converts to long-term injury reserve
questions.explanation: Permanently disabled players receive insurance payment and team can apply for cap relief.

questions.question: Can contracts include incentives based on team performance (making playoffs, winning championship)?
options: Yes, without restriction
No, only individual performance incentives allowed
Yes, but they count as likely bonuses
Only for veteran minimum contracts
questions.explanation: Both individual and team performance incentives are allowed without restriction.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of teams a Two-Way player can be signed with during a season?
options: Only 1 team
Up to 2 teams
Up to 3 teams
No limit
questions.explanation: Two-Way players can sign with up to 3 teams per season with 50-day total NBA limit.

questions.question: Can a player under contract negotiate with other teams during the season?
options: Yes, if they have a player option for next year
No, this would violate tampering rules
Yes, in the final year of their contract
Only during the trade deadline period
questions.explanation: Players under contract cannot negotiate with other teams until free agency.

questions.question: What portion of a player's salary on a non-guaranteed contract must be guaranteed if signed after January 10?
options: None, can still be non-guaranteed
50% must be guaranteed
100% for the remainder of that season
Prorated amount based on games remaining
questions.explanation: Contracts signed after January 10 must be fully guaranteed for remainder of that season.

questions.question: Can a player's agent fees be paid by the team instead of the player?
options: Yes, teams can pay agent fees
No, this is strictly prohibited
Yes, but only for rookie contracts
Only if approved by the league
questions.explanation: Teams are strictly prohibited from paying agent fees as it would circumvent salary cap rules.

questions.question: What is the earliest date a contract extension can become effective?
options: Immediately upon signing
The following season after the original contract expires
30 days after signing
The trade deadline
questions.explanation: Extensions cannot take effect until the original contract expires.

questions.question: Can a player's contract include a provision for additional compensation if they are selected to the All-Star game?
options: Yes, this is a common incentive bonus
No, All-Star selection bonuses are prohibited
Yes, but only for veteran minimum contracts
Only if they were an All-Star the previous year
questions.explanation: All-Star selection is a permissible performance incentive.

questions.question: If a player retires, can they 'unretire' and return to the same contract?
options: Yes, the contract remains valid indefinitely
Yes, but only within the same season
Yes, but the team has the right to void the contract
No, retirement voids the contract permanently
questions.explanation: Players can attempt to unretire but team can choose to honor or void the remaining contract.

questions.question: What is the maximum amount of a 10-day contract?
options: Fixed at $50,000
Prorated veteran minimum based on player's years of service
Prorated rookie minimum
Negotiated individually up to prorated max
questions.explanation: 10-day contracts pay prorated veteran minimum based on years of service.

questions.question: Can a contract include a clause requiring the player to maintain a certain weight or body fat percentage?
options: Yes, weight clauses are permitted
No, this would violate player rights
Yes, but only for centers
Only with player association approval
questions.explanation: Weight or body composition clauses are permitted but must be reasonable and health-appropriate.

questions.question: What happens to a player's contract if the NBA season is cancelled or shortened?
options: Players receive full salary regardless
Salaries are reduced proportionally to games played
Depends on the force majeure provision in the CBA
Players become free agents
questions.explanation: The CBA includes force majeure provisions that address compensation during cancellations or interruptions.

questions.question: Can a team include an offset provision in a guaranteed contract?
options: Yes, any guaranteed contract can include offsets
No, offset provisions are prohibited in guaranteed contracts
Yes, but only for non-basketball injury guarantees
Only in rookie contracts
questions.explanation: Offset provisions are only allowed for non-basketball injury protections.

questions.question: What is required for a contract to include a player option?
options: Player must have 7+ years of service
Contract must be at least 3 years
Simply negotiated as part of the agreement
Player must be making maximum salary
questions.explanation: Player options are simply a negotiated term with no service or salary requirements.

questions.question: Can a player's contract be converted from non-guaranteed to fully guaranteed mid-season?
options: Yes, through contract amendment
No, guarantee status is fixed at signing
Only on January 10 (guarantee date)
Only if player is traded
questions.explanation: Teams can amend contracts to add guarantees at any time.

questions.question: Are players required to participate in training camp under their contract?
options: Yes, attendance is mandatory
No, training camp is optional
Only for rookie contract players
Only if specifically stated in the contract
questions.explanation: Standard contracts require training camp attendance. Failure to report results in fines.

questions.question: Can a player's contract specify which jersey number they will wear?
options: Yes, this is commonly negotiated
No, jersey numbers are team decisions only
Only for max contract players
Only if the number is retired
questions.explanation: Jersey numbers are team decisions and not part of contract negotiations.

questions.question: What happens if a player is suspended by the league for conduct violations?
options: They continue to receive full salary
Salary is withheld for suspension period
Contract can be voided
Player receives 50% salary during suspension
questions.explanation: Salary is withheld for the duration of league-imposed suspensions.

questions.question: Can a team include a provision requiring the player to live in a specific city during the offseason?
options: Yes, this is standard in all contracts
No, players have freedom of residence in offseason
Yes, but only for franchise players
Only if the player agrees
questions.explanation: Teams cannot require specific offseason residence. Players have freedom to live where they choose.

questions.question: If a player is traded mid-season, who is responsible for their salary for the remainder of the season?
options: The team that traded them
The acquiring team
Split between both teams
Paid by the league
questions.explanation: The acquiring team assumes full salary responsibility from the trade date forward.
